greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle giving maximal permanent P(n,k) of an n X n lower Hessenberg (0,1)-matrix with exactly k 1's for 2 <= n <= k <= 2n, read by rows.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for rows 2 to 50, flattened
D. D. Olesky, B. L. Shader and P. van den Driessche, Permanents of Hessenberg (0,1)-matrices, Electronic Journal of Combinatorics, 12 (2005) #R70.
B. Shader Table of known values of P(n,k) for n<=12.
mathematica: Table[2^(Floor[(k - n)/2]), {n, 2, 51}, {k, n, 2*n}] // Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 11 2017 *)
program: (PARI) for(n=2,25, for(k=n,2*n, print1(2^(floor((k-n)/2)), ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 11 2017
results.author: Bryan Shader (bshader(AT)uwyo.edu), Jan 07 2006
